website_summaries.verdict: Expensive digital camera that offers good image quality and good low-light performance.
pros: Records normally at 16 megapixels, but also includes a 40-megapixel recording mode
Burst mode capability is outstanding at up to 10 frames per second
Offers an electronic viewfinder to frame the scene
Uses a 5-axis image stabilization technology for low-light photos
cons: Higher price than some mirrorless cameras
Must spend extra to buy lenses

website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus OM-D E-M5 Mark II has a unique high-resolution capture mode, but it's not the best camera for shooting fast-moving subjects.
cons: High Res mode requires sturdy tripod and static subject

customer_reviews.title: Such a terrific camera!
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Olympus OMD E-M5 and it still works, but gave the old one to my daughter and bought this updated version. Not much has changed, and the pictures are still amazing, but does have some nice updated features (love that I can transfer pics via WiFi -great for vacation.) I am a loyal Olympus user and really feel the camera works as well as a quality DSLR. The lens collection continually updates - love the PRO series lenses. This is an easy to use camera with TONS of features. Take terrific pictures even for those who simply want to take photos on the auto function. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Elsomalo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Value in a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: Going into Micro Four Thirds, I wasn't entirely convinced that the camera could be as good as larger DSLRs. I saw that the sensors were small and grimaced when I thought of low-light performance. When I got the camera, I was blown away by how it was able to take such nice photos in all conditions. While performance above ISO 1600 is poor, it is able to get nice shots on my constant f2.8 PRO series lenses. I would recommend this to an enthusiast looking to upgrade their photography to a new level. I was able to purchase my camera used, and it gave me amazing value and still wonderful camera, showing a good durability. All in all, great value!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio M.

customer_reviews.title: Great M43 Camera
customer_reviews.text: This a great M43 camera. I love the retro styling and it has great image quality. It did take quite a bit of time to setup, and the menu system is not intuitive. But there is a plenty of info on-line to assist. Another nit is that it is too easy to bump the back knob and change a setting. However after setting it up, and using enough to learn it, this is my definite go-to camera. I am not using my DSLRs these days.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: I like the size of the camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the camera, but even as an experienced photographer, the menu is way too complicated. You spend more time figuring out the menu than actually shooting.
customer_reviews.author: kittenhead

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, lousy battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Getting used to a few of the preset, settings for action shots is a little challenging after coming from a DSLR but overall i like the camera. Its only downfall for me is the battery life. I always carry 3 with me but it would be nice if olympus could source a longer lasting battery as standard.
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Great camera - so rich in features and retains the excellent Olympus build quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I did buy an off-label grip which makes it a joy to handle - like the OME1, and the larger eyecup but all in all it has all the weather features I love and need here in the Rockies.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny's Store

customer_reviews.title: Great features, almost completely customizable
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely solid camera. Great features, almost completely customizable. Amazing lens selection. Loving micro four thirds!
customer_reviews.author: Scrump

customer_reviews.title: Seriously nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! I am still getting to know this camera and learning more about it's features but does a great gob on the Auto mode too.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great, BUT!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with amazing features. Only problem is that two months after purchase the screen stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Omri Blit

customer_reviews.title: the Focus keeps changing
customer_reviews.text: Although this feature is an improvement, that is, you can pick on each image where you want the focus to be, sometimes you inadvertently change it when you hand touches the ring, and you miss the shot!! Otherwise I am getting tack sharp photos and the camera and zoom lens is so much fun to use!!
customer_reviews.author: barbara c.

customer_reviews.title: Just do it.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the camera. I purchased it for use in photographing classical music performances for a job I'm working. I'm potentially close to selling all my Nikon equipment (all 2.8 glass) and just jump into m43. I would've given it 5 stars, but battery performance leaves one star off the board. I've got it paired with a 14mm 2.5 Panasonic lens, the 45mm 1.8, and a Sigma 19mm 2.8 and really love it for a travel setup. Much lighter than my dslr bag/setup. I've had luck shooting 5 second exposure handheld with the built in stabilization. It's amazing. Make sure you update to the newest firmware right away. Very laggy on FW 1.0.
customer_reviews.author: anotherphotographer

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautifully designed compact yet powerful camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully designed compact yet powerful camera. Will take months to learn all of its features, but fun to shoot on auto while learning. Definitely recommend purchasing an aftermarket guide like Darrell Young's Mastering the Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie B Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift I've Ever Given Myself
customer_reviews.text: I am blown away by this camera. Solid beyond belief. Easier than pie to use. Photo quality is amazing and video top notch. A lot of features yet to learn, but I am sure to be happy with this for many, many years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Fred H

customer_reviews.title: Gift, great...
customer_reviews.text: It's good...i got it as a gift for my wife... she now takes pictures yay
customer_reviews.author: collin price

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. Always get compliments on how retro it looks too lol.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: pictures came out great
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of the interface, pictures came out great though
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera although still learning all you can do ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera although still learning all you can do with it! Traded up from my Panasonic Lumix so using those lenses. Works well except sometimes during video it gets super blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Toohey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and beautiful photos
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a my first non-smartphone camera and couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible build quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always babied my Olympus. Recently the camera body does not recognize any of the lens I own. When it does connect it is intermittent and impossible to capture a decent shot as it fades in and out of a state where a photo can be taken. Autofocus is nonexistent. I will never buy Olympus again after my experience with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: JasonF

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Olympus M5 is great after day 2 of using it. I haven't used it on portrait photography even though my style is portraits but just doing nature photography right now to get to know the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Andre A.J. Place

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for hiking, autofocus a little off for flying birds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Camera and very pleased with the quality of the product and the pictures it takes.
customer_reviews.author: Ian H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having had another Olympus camera that I loved. This one is ALSO one I love! Tons of features (many still to be learned!) the focus is super fast and it feels good in your hands. With a fast SD card, you can just mash down on the go button and take pictures like a madman without the buffer filling up in 5 shots. Being a hiker/backpacker I VERY much appreciate the light weight compared to my Canon camera. I am very happy with this at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgehiker

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera for shooting videos for work
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera for shooting videos for work. Takes great pictures as well, and very easy and light to take with you
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it
customer_reviews.text: Everything is so amazing about this camera. I absolutely love it 100%
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera changed everything for me. Fast focusing and sharp photos. Pair this camera body with the right lenses and you have an unbeatable camera system in this price range. So great that it doesn't weigh you down since the camera is so small. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Sharp hand held pictures with a zoom lense, OK the moon picture was taken with a tripod and using the 40mb stacked.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know what to say except I REALLY enjoy using this camera. I have the old 4/3 Olympus 50-200mm (that is 100-400mm in 35mm equivalence) zoom lens and I now tend to leave the mono-pod behind. I can take a picture of a plumbing vent flashing on the roof of a two story home and be able to zoom in and tell if it is one of the two commonly used brands here in the DFW area "Oatey or IPS". Amazingly sharp pictures using the same lenses I already own from my old Olympus EPL5. I'll add some pictures after I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I like the additional features
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded form an OMD EM10. I like the additional features. Brought only one lens with me on a two week trip , the 14-150 and it was perfect. Still getting used to all the features and even some of the basic photography. Bottom line, great camera if you don't want to lug around a large DSLR. Performed to my satisfaction. The camera is great, I just need to improve my camera skills!
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera. It takes wonderful photos when using great lenses and cheap lenses. Nice and compact body.
customer_reviews.author: Wood Worker

customer_reviews.title: very nice camera, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera. I updated from an em10. The build quality, viewfinder, and lcd are better. It's fast but startup times lagged when sleeping. I disabled quick sleep and this fixed the problem. I prefer the flip screen on the em10 but I can live with the articulated one on the em5ii.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B.

customer_reviews.title: and I feel like I got a huge upgrade
customer_reviews.text: this camera is everything I want it to be, and then some. bought it to replace my Nikon d80, and I feel like I got a huge upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Don Knotts

customer_reviews.title: Good camera. Bad interactive/computer interface.
customer_reviews.text: As a relative photography novice, I really do like the camera. But as a tech-savy person, I HATE the GPS interface. There is something seriously wrong with the interface design! After several months I'm still not sure it actually works. Really, the entire process of interacting on the computer is not good. (This is 2018. It shouldn't be this hard.)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. In-body stabilization is uncannily good, can get shots that would easily require a tripod with any other camera. Very versatile, well-built, and takes excellent images. If you don't need to larger prints or 4K video, then this is the camera for you.
customer_reviews.author: Wynand32

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I am having a blast learning how to use this! It is a beautiful Camera!
customer_reviews.author: Ripleey

customer_reviews.title: Image quality is good and stabilizing is better
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is good and stabilizing is better. However, I couldn't get past the terrible menu. Video quality is on par with other 1080p cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this camera, and all her friends ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this camera, and all her friends want one. She is studying abroad in Europe for a semester and combination of these two lenses give her freedom and convenience to shoot indoor and outdoor. 17mm f1.8 and 14-42mm f3.5-5.6
customer_reviews.author: Boomerbug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for both pro and amateur alike
customer_reviews.text: Just as Advertized. Perfect for both pro and amateur alike.
customer_reviews.author: FoxwellT

customer_reviews.title: happy with the form and function
customer_reviews.text: happy with the form and function. does what i need it to do and with no hesitation or problems.
customer_reviews.author: gearheadskyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and sophisticated
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable 4x3 camera. Menu system a bit bizarre, you need to buy a book or look up manuals on the Web, but once you get the hang of it you benefit from remarkable features such as a silent burst ("sequential shooting") mode. Very versatile, applicable to many different kinds of photography.
customer_reviews.author: Technophile

customer_reviews.title: The camera is amazing. It's very nice
customer_reviews.text: The camera is amazing. It's very nice. I like silver, and silver is more beautiful than black. It's not big, so it's easy to take out. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: BoWang

customer_reviews.title: it's a fantastic camera.
customer_reviews.text: WoW! it's a fantastic camera... can't say any negative words on it.
customer_reviews.author: Juanito V. Decastro Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, weighty feel, just need to learn how to fully utilise the options.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Moore

customer_reviews.title: The improvement for lowlight is quite good. The EVF is a lot better but it ...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Panasonic GX-1. The improvement for lowlight is quite good. The EVF is a lot better but it is taking time to get used to the new Menu. I miss the integrated flash, however the low light performance helps me push the boundary a bit. When I paired it with the PRO lens and the performance went up a notch. Overall I do see other improvements in color and sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram Shrivastava

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I traded an OMD EM10 in to get this one. This is the MOST AMAZING camera I've ever used, especially using the 40 megapixel setting. With this camera, it's HARD to take a bad photo. Try it, you'll fall in love with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C Sarratt

customer_reviews.title: Worthy Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: 5-axis IBIS really made this camera for me. I rarely have to use a tripod anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas McGhee

customer_reviews.title: I haven't figured out half of this camera's full capability ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't figured out half of this camera's full capability yet and I'm already beyond impressed with the picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Solid camera, but for the price it just wasn't that great of an experience. Pros: -beautiful build quality -compact body -tons of features Cons -frustrating and confusing menu system -significant lag when powering up (caused me to miss a lot of good pictures) -struggles with auto focusing sometimes -poor battery life I returned this product because it was more frustrating than enjoyable to use.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: So far meets all of my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have had the camera for less than a day, and only taken about forty photos, but so far so good. The E-M5 II has all of the features I want in a camera: small and lightweight, awesome image stabilization, a silent shutter option, fully articulating touch LCD, the ability to customize the camera and excellent image quality. Also, I have tried the high res mode and it works great as long as you are using a tripod. I will update the review if anything changes. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! Paired it with the 12-40/f2.8 and 40-150/f2.8 lenses and can't get over how good it is. I do occasionally hit the buttons accidentally, but may try the new grip when it comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera. But it has the most confusing menu ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. But it has the most confusing menu I have ever experienced. However I am beginning to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: M.Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Falling in love with it over and over again <3
customer_reviews.author: Joud

customer_reviews.title: Loyal Olympus Fan
customer_reviews.text: Oh my, what a difference. Can't wait to go on another cruise.
customer_reviews.author: PJL

customer_reviews.title: Field tested for 24 hours and returned... ...
customer_reviews.text: Field tested for 24 hours and returned....this is coming from an EM1 user. My needs were video and photo....this is where the OMD codec was lacking....focus tracking also unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

product_meta.title: Olympus OM-D E-M5 Mark II (Silver) (Body Only)
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Style:Camera Only| Configuration:BaseThe new OM-D E-M5 Mark II features the most sophisticated image stabilization technology ever offered in an interchangeable lens camera.* The ultra-sensitive 5-axis VCM (voice coil motor) system is so responsive and accurate, you can shoot sharp images in low light and capture silky smooth video, hand-held without a tripod. The E-M5 Mark II is also a bring-it-anywhere portable system camera that is nearly 40% lighter than conventional DSLR’s and its durable all metal body is sealed for splashproof, dustproof and freezeproof protection.To know more about pixel mapping, please visit : http://www.olympusamerica.com/crm/oneoffpages/ask_oly/crm_e_ask_oly_03_09.asp.
feature_bullets: Powerful 5 axis voice coil motor image stabilization system greatly reduces blur resulting from camera shake
Operating temperature: 32 104°F/0 40°C. 16MP Live MOS sensor with 40MP high resolution shot mode
10 frames per second high speed sequential shooting
Full HD 1080: 60p, 30p, 25p, 24p video capabilities with focus peaking
Built in Wi Fi, Focus mode: Continuous servo AF (C), Manual focus (M), Single servo AF (S), Autofocus points 81

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars179 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
